intro: Streblacanthus dubiosus, commonly known as the dubious streblacanthus, is a rare and lesser-known plant species belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its unique morphological features, including hairy stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers. Native to specific regions in South America, it thrives in humid, tropical environments. The plant's leaves are typically ovate with serrated edges, and its flowers range in color from pale yellow to deep orange. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
